candidates.title: Limit the maximum number of deltas in an RRDP notification.
candidates.body:
This PR limits the number of entries in the notification file of an RRDP repository that Routinator is willing to consider. This can be set through the new `rrdp-max-delta-list-len` configuration value which defaults to a hopefully safe 500.

If this number is exceeded, the delta list will be considered to be empty and ignore, resulting in snapshots to be used.

candidates.title: Upgrade to tokio-rustls 0.25.
candidates.body: This PR upgrades the _tokio-rustls_ dependency to 0.25 to be on par with the version used by reqwest.

candidates.title: Upgrade hyper to 1.0.
candidates.body: This PR updates hyper to 1.0 and adjusts the built-in HTTP server accordingly.

candidates.title: Enforce same origin for all resources of an RRDP server.
candidates.body: This PR enforces that all resources fetched for an RRDP server have the same origin as the URI provided in the CA certificate. It checks this for all URIs provided in the server’s notification file and restricts redirects to URIs with the same origin.

candidates.title: Import and switch to new UI.
candidates.body:
This PR switches to using version 0.4.0 of the Routinator UI. It also changes the way we import the UI into Routinator by simply including the built assets in the `contrib/ui` directory and updating them if necessary.

The PR also imports the mechanism to collect assets and provide them to the HTTP server from the now deprecated `routinator-ui` crate.

candidates.title: Store manifest number and check for regressions.
candidates.body:
This PR adds a check for manifest number regressions when validating a collected publication point. It stores the manifest number for each manifest and checks against it when collecting a new manifest. If the latter’s number has not increased, it falls back to the stored manifest. This behaviour is mandated by RFC 9286.

The PR changes the data stored for manifests and thus updates the `StoredManifest` version to 1. In order to avoid an endless stream of error messages after an upgrade, it downgrades the logged message when encountering an malformed `StoredManifest` to DEBUG.

Fixes #913.

candidates.title: Don’t have the RTR listener fail if a socket fails after accept.
candidates.body:
This PR changes the RTR listener to not fail the accept loop when setting up a stream after accepting it fails. Instead it will quietly drop the stream in this case and keep going.

As part of this, the PR also drops tokio-stream as a dependency and implements its own listener stream.

This PR fixes [CVE-2024-1622](https://www.nlnetlabs.nl/downloads/routinator/CVE-2024-1622.txt) reported by Yohei Nishimura, Atsushi Enomoto, Ruka Miyachi; Internet Multifeed Co., Japan.

This PR is a forward port of #937.

candidates.title: Don’t have the RTR listener fail if a socket fails after accept.
candidates.body:
This PR changes the RTR listener to not fail the accept loop when setting up a stream after accepting it fails. Instead it will quietly drop the stream in this case and keep going.

As part of this, the PR also drops tokio-stream as a dependency and implements its own listener stream.

This PR fixes [CVE-2024-1622](https://www.nlnetlabs.nl/downloads/routinator/CVE-2024-1622.txt) reported by Yohei Nishimura, Atsushi Enomoto, Ruka Miyachi; Internet Multifeed Co., Japan.

candidates.title: Upgrade rpki-rs to 0.18.1 and ring to 0.17.
candidates.body:
This PR upgrades rpki-rs to 0.18.1 and, as a consequence, ring to 0.17.

This fixes #919, i.e., RTR server version negotiation, and additionally disables support for RTR version 2.

We’re considering this a non-breaking release since it doesn’t change any public interfaces published by Routinator.

candidates.title: Accept EC PRIVATE KEY items in PEM files. (0.13 backport)
candidates.body:
This PR adds support for private keys marked as “EC PRIVATE KEY“ in the PEM files for TLS server configuration.

This is a backport of #909 to the 0.13 series.

candidates.title: Replace `num_cpus` with `std::thread::available_parallelism`.
candidates.body:
This PR removes the dependency on the num_cpus crate by using the standard library’s `std::thread::available_parallelism` instead.

Fixes #902.

candidates.title: Upgrade rpki-rs and ring.
candidates.body: This PR upgrades rpki-rs to 0.18 and ring to 0.17.

candidates.title: Exclude the manual from the cargo package.
candidates.body: This PR excludes the `doc/manual` directory from the files included with the package uploaded to crates.io when publishing.

candidates.title: Update dependencies.
candidates.body: This PR updates all dependencies to their latest published versions.

candidates.title: Force bcder to be at least 0.7.3.
candidates.body:
This PR upgrade the dependency of `bcder` to be at least version 0.7.3. This will fix a number of possible panics when illegal RPKI objects are parsed.

This PR provides the fix for CVE-2023-39915.

candidates.title: Store RRDP data in one file per repository.
candidates.body: This PR implements a very simple archive that can be used to store, update, and access the objects published by an RRDP repository in a single file.

candidates.title: Update dependencies.
candidates.body:
This PR updates the dependencies:

* since _toml_ has changed too much, switches to _toml_edit_,
*  with scoped threads and once writable cells now available in std, it also drops the _crossbeam-utils_ and _once_cell_ crates.

Increases the minimum supported Rust version to 1.70. This makes it a breaking change.

candidates.title: Update rpki-rs version.
candidates.body: This PR updates the rpki-rs crate to version 0.17.1. This allows dropping the dependency on the base64 crate.

candidates.title: Adjust to revised ASPA profile.
candidates.body: This PR adjusts to the new profile and payload data for ASPA by dropping support for multiple address families in the provider AS set.

candidates.title: Move enabling of ASPA behind a feature flag.
candidates.body:
This PR moves the config and command line options to enable ASPA behind a feature flag `aspa` which is not part of the default features. All the actual ASPA code is still there, it is just now impossible to enable ASPA without the flag.

This change is necessary because the ASPA object format and RTR PDUs are currently changing and we want to avoid people accidentally using a draft version that is incompatible with the final standard. The feature will be removed as soon as the standardization process has advanced sufficiently to avoid this risk.

The PR removes the `enable-aspa` config and command line options from the manual page.

candidates.title: Drop dependency on routecore.
candidates.body: This PR removes the dependency on _routecore_ and uses the types defined in _rpki-rs_ instead.

candidates.title: Increase minimal Rust version to 1.65.
candidates.body: This PR increases the minimal Rust version to 1.65.

candidates.title: Handle router keys in local exceptions.
candidates.body:
This PR adds both filtering and adding router keys based on local exceptions.

Fixes #849.

candidates.title: Add a notification endpoint to the json-delta protocol.
candidates.body:
The PR adds a new endpoint `/json-delta/notify` that waits with responding until new data is available and then returns a JSON object with the session ID and serial number.

This seems to be a better solution than a websocket as it doesn’t require new dependencies.

Fixes #723.

candidates.title: Rewrite logging.
candidates.body:
This PR implements all log handling with the exception of actual syslog in Routinator itself. It also implements support for log rotation when logging into files by re-opening the log file when receiving SIGUSR2.

Error handling for logging is now such that if trying to log to file or syslog fails, Routinator will exit. It will also exit if it receives SIGUSR2 and can’t open the log file.

The motivation for this is that the log is used by many people to determine issues with the RPKI repositories, so silently not having logs seems bad. Also, not being able to log is a good indication for bigger problems to come.

Fixes #468. Fixes #732.

candidates.title: Switch to rpki-rs 0.16.1 and downgrade to Rust 1.63.
candidates.body: This PR switches the dependencies on rpki-rs to the released 0.16.1 and on routecore to 0.3.1. As a consequence, the minimum required Rust version can be lowered to 1.63.

candidates.title: Add support for ASPA.
candidates.body:
This PR adds support for ASPA to Routinator.

The PR adds a new config option `enable_aspa` that is `false` by default. Only if it is set  to `true` will ASPAs be added to the payload set.

It add support for processing ASPA objects to the engine, adds ASPA related metrics, and completely refactors the payload storage to be able to deal with the differing semantics of ASPA payload.

The PR adds a new `"aspa"` member to the jsonext format and the HTTP delta endpoint. It adds new members to the API status and adds new Prometheus metrics.

This PR increases the minimum required Rust version to 0.65.

This is a breaking change.

Fixes #812.

candidates.title: Bump minimum Rust version to 1.64 and update dependencies.
candidates.body:
This PR updates the dependencies and, in order to do that, needs to bump the minimal supported Rust version to 1.64.

This is a breaking change.

candidates.title: Bump tokio version and update dependencies.

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.22.0 to 1.24.2.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.24.1

This release fixes a compilation failure on targets without AtomicU64 when using rustc older than 1.63. (#5356)

#5356: tokio-rs/tokio#5356

Tokio v1.24.0

The highlight of this release is the reduction of lock contention for all I/O operations (#5300). We have received reports of up to a 20% improvement in CPU utilization and increased throughput for real-world I/O heavy applications.

Fixed

  • rt: improve native AtomicU64 support detection (#5284)

Added

  • rt: add configuration option for max number of I/O events polled from the OS per tick (#5186)
  • rt: add an environment variable for configuring the default number of worker threads per runtime instance (#4250)

Changed

  • sync: reduce MPSC channel stack usage (#5294)
  • io: reduce lock contention in I/O operations (#5300)
  • fs: speed up read_dir() by chunking operations (#5309)
  • rt: use internal ThreadId implementation (#5329)
  • test: don't auto-advance time when a spawn_blocking task is running (#5115)

#5186: tokio-rs/tokio#5186 #5294: tokio-rs/tokio#5294 #5284: tokio-rs/tokio#5284 #4250: tokio-rs/tokio#4250 #5300: tokio-rs/tokio#5300 #5329: tokio-rs/tokio#5329 #5115: tokio-rs/tokio#5115 #5309: tokio-rs/tokio#5309

Tokio v1.23.1

This release forward ports changes from 1.18.4.

Fixed

  • net: fix Windows named pipe server builder to maintain option when toggling pipe mode (#5336).

#5336: tokio-rs/tokio#5336

Tokio v1.23.0

Fixed

  • net: fix Windows named pipe connect (#5208)
  • io: support vectored writes for ChildStdin (#5216)
  • io: fix async fn ready() false positive for OS-specific events (#5231)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=tokio&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.22.0&new-version=1.24.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/network/alerts).

candidates.title: Gracefully deal with failing timestamp conversions.
candidates.body: This PR switches to using the non-panicking versions of chrono’s timestamp conversion methods introduced in 0.4.23.

candidates.title: Add missing rsync install-time dependency for cross-compiled DEBs.
candidates.body:
Fixes #817.

Note that the latest 0.12.0-dev DEB does **NOT** have this problem because there are [bugs in the reusable packaging workflow](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/ploutos/issues/19) concerning minimal and cross cargo-deb variant selection when building DEBs, so this "fix" doesn't actually fix anything because by accident it isn't currently broken. When the reusable packaging workflow bugs are fixed, then this fix will be needed.

candidates.title: Upgrade reusable packaging workflow
candidates.body:
This PR upgrades the `pkg` workflow to use the latest version of the NLnet Labs [Ploutos](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/ploutos/) reusable packaging workflow. There have been a number of breaking releases of Ploutos fixing bugs, improving performance and simplifying its use:

- [v2](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/releases/v2.0.0) checks for RPM scriptlet errors, eliminates 23 annoying Github workflow run warnings (caused by deprecated actions and the coming upgrade by GH to NodeJS 16) and introduces (optional) support for systemd unit management in RPM scriptlets. This PR adopts the new RPM systemd unit management behaviour. A check of the new managed behaviour vs the old manual behaviour shows that the only difference is use of newer systemctl command syntax on systems that support it, e.g. use of `--now` to achieve in one command what requires two commands on older systemd versions. The new systemd managed script fragments also include an explicit `systemd-reload`.

- [v3](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/releases/v3.0.0) simplified usage by folding the `xxx_rules_path` functionality into the `xxx_rules` workflow inputs., fixes an issue with `minimal` profile selection on older O/S's, and removes the need for manual specification of cross-compilation targets (these are now determined automatically from the other workflow inputs). This PR updates the `pkg` workflow to follow the `xxx_rules` changes.

- [v4](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/releases/v4.0.0) of the packaging workflow enables cross-compilation to take place in parallel with non-cross compilation thereby speeding up the workflow. In the case of Routinator this seems to reduce the time from ~16m to ~8m, about a 50% reduction!

- [v5](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/ploutos/releases/tag/v5.0.0) simplified usage by removing the need to specify redundant DEB maintainer name/email and package testing rule inputs, and fixes issues with slow `yum` operations and broken DEB changelog generation.

This PR:
- Adjusts the inputs passed in `pkg.yml` to Ploutou to match the breaking changes made to Ploutos.
  - Remove no longer supported or needed `deb_maintainer` Ploutos input.
  - Remove no longer needed `cross_build_rules` Ploutos input and associated `pkg/rules/cross-targets.yml` file, Ploutos will determine cross-compilation targets itself based on the `package_build_rules` input.
  - Remove no longer needed `package_test_rules` Ploutos input and associated `pkg/rules/packages-to-test.yml` file.
  - Updates `pkg/rules/packages-to-build.yml` to include the `mode` key used by the Ploutos `pkg-test` job now that `packages-to-test.yml` no longer defines it.
  - Replaces manual invocation of systemd commands in `pkg/rpm/scriptlets.toml` with the `#RPM_SYSTEMD_MACROS#` placeholder instead which Ploutos replaces at package building time with appropriate systemd commands (just as cargo-deb does for DEBs).
- Re-orders and groups related Ploutos workflow inputs in `pkg.yml`.
- Removes the unused minimal-cross cargo-deb variant from `Cargo.toml` and the related `pkg/common/routinator-minimal-cross.routinator.service` file.

A test run of the `pkg` workflow in this PR branch can be seen here: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/3591659903.

candidates.body: This PR updates all dependencies to their latest version.
